reviews.review_msg: I really liked Nichole, I thought her class was fair and so were the exams. This is NOT a curved class which really helps so if you usually dont score around the class average I would suggest you take this class to help save your GPA!

Probably my favorite class in my undergrad thus far, and I'm in my 4th year. Nichole is very approachable and gives CLEAR guidelines on all tasks; if you are truly interested in learning about motivation, and your own personal tendencies, take this course, hands down, you will not regret it.
Comes off as rude at times class is ok but weekly quizzes short answer questions are marked way too hard.

The written questions on the weekly quizzes and exams were unreasonable because they were super picky and unless you wrote every little piece of information relevant you wouldn't get full marks. Also the paper was only based on citing the text and how much info u can include which is ridiculous and offers no flexibility. Do not take this course.

Woah so the other comments are definitely people who are butt hurt but chilllll, this class was such as good one, Nichole is a gem and is VERY clear on exactly what you need to know to do well. Everything is very well organized, 2 exams (m/c + short answer), weekly quizzes, 1 paper (apply the course concepts).. textbook not necessary but helps

REALLY DRY LECTURES. Sometimes i feel like he is just talking to himself rather than teaching. Get ready to read the textbook in your own time because his accent and teaching method just does not work. Midterm worths 45% and final was 50%. Good luck.

Lectures were kind of hit or miss. He seemed really interested in some material he covered and others he seemed bored. There's a midterm, final, and some short quizzes. I was really confused about how much quizzes are worth but they're super easy so go to class to do them! Overall not an amazing prof but he's not bad and he's a really nice guy.
super boring lectures that are not really related to the textbook. Midterm had basically nothing from the lecture

My advise: keep up w/ weekly readings & go through lecture slides for exams. You could pass w/o going to class but you will lose 10% for participation marks. A lot of people complain about his accent and that it interfered w/ their understanding but I didn't mind it and actually thought lectures were decent! Overall, I would recommend PSYC 389!
pretty harsh grader, seems open but not really
